titleStmt.title: To his good friende, Ma. An. Mundy.
titleStmt.author: Dekker, Thomas

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: To his good friende, Ma. An. Mundy.
analytic.author: Dekker, Thomas

monogr.title: The third and last part of Palmerin of England : Enterlaced with the loues and fortunes of many gallant knights and ladies: a historie full of most choise and sweet varietie. VVritten in Spanish, Italian, and French, and translated into English by A.M. one of the messengers of her Maiesties chamber

div.head: To his good friende, Ma. An. Mundy.

lg.l: IF pure translation reach as high a glory
As best inuention: (to denie't were sinne)
Then thou (deere friend) in publishing this Story,
Hast grac'd thy selfe, and thy queint Palmerin,
Thou much by him, he most by thee shall win.
For tho in courtly French hee sweetly spake,
A harder labour thou doost vndertake
Thus to create him a fine Englishman,
VVhose Language now dare more then any can.
Nor thou, nor Palmerin in choice doe erre:
Thou of thy Scholler, he his Schoolemaister.
